subsection.text: Your Strength (Bash) check covers situations where you would like to break or disable various structures. Breaking simple locks, opening doors, bending bars, and even ‘disabling’ traps can be accomplished, depending on the material in question. Failing a Bash check comes with an added liability of making locks and doors inoperable, and setting off traps you intended to disable.

Using the Attack action, you can make a special melee attack to Disarm a creature, either to knock the weapon away from it or to sunder the item completely (beat the contest by 10). If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your disarm must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach. You make a Strength (Bash) check contested by the target's Strength (Bash) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you knock the weapon 10 feet away from you, or sunder if you beat the contest by 10. A Sundered Weapon cannot be used until it is fixed.
Special: To sunder a magical item, the item in question must also be magical of an equal bonus or higher. A +1 flametongue longsword cannot sunder a +2 dagger.

Any time a feature states that a character cannot be lost, you should replace it with the following: When you are in the wilderness, you can at any time retrace your steps exactly the way you came, until you return to the Town. Once you return to the Town, this ability resets.
When Unconscious status ends, gain exhaustion.
When revived from the dead, gain a permanent injury, unless the party succeeds a skill challenge.
Healing undead instead damages them, for the maximum amount the spell or ability would do. They can make a charisma saving throw for half. The DC is 8+Proficiency+Casting stat.
Short Rests take 8 hours and long rests take one week (Relaxation Downtime Action). Short rests remove 1 stack of exhaustion, Long rests remove all stacks of exhaustion.
